post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
Anybody here?
My new blog: http://localhost:43110/1MBFot8DT9hBbjULhMay9t2oHZq1bwzuvT/
Another reason against Google: http://www.androidcentral.com/if-you-buy-pixel-resell-it-you-may-get-your-google-account-banned
Agar.io fake on Google Play...

It begins.
At best everyone should use p2p to be protected from that.
http://www.theverge.com/2016/11/23/13718768/uk-surveillance-laws-explained-investigatory-powers-bill
http://arstechnica.com/security/2016/11/google-warns-journalists-and-professors-your-account-is-under-attack/
I finally got a domain: http://localhost:43110/mkg20001.bit

(German) https://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Oesterreichs-Innenminister-fordert-lueckenlose-Ueberwachung-3589540.html

"In allen Fragen lückenlose Überwachung", will Österreichs Innenminister Sobotka: Direkter Zugriff auf private Überwachungskameras, massive Kennzeichenerfassung, "vorbeugende" Fußfesseln, Handys als mobile Wanzen, Bundestrojaner für das Urheberrecht.

(English) tl;dr Austrias Secretary of the Interior ("Innenminister") wants total surveillance *EVERYWHERE IN AUSTRIA*
Diep.io fake on google play. Not to mention that there is already an agar.io fake out there

Holy shit is that awesome! It has even push support!

Currently taking the ZeroNet-kivy apk apart to find out why it is so big.
Seems like kivy is really big.
Does anybody here have an idea what could possibly be removed from the apk?

Trying to create a js implementation of ZeroNet
https://github.com/mkg20001/zeronet-js
https://npmjs.com/package/zeronet

Edit: Seems like there are lots of undocumented commands.
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/network_protocol/ only lists 4 but there are more. https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/987

The **German** (not Russia, not China, but GERMANY) government plans to intercept WhatsApp's end-to-end encryption using their so-called "Staatstrojaner" (State Trojan) virus.
They also changed some laws regarding surveillance to do it completely legal.

This includes the ability to hack a suspects device or even to search through all his data, legally.

German news: 
 - [WhatsApp-Chats im Visier: Bundestag winkt Überwachungsgesetz durch](http://www.chip.de/news/WhatsApp-Chats-im-Visier-Bundestag-winkt-Ueberwachungsgesetz-durch_117386888.html)
 - [Dein trojanischer Freund und Helfer](https://www.golem.de/news/staatstrojaner-dein-trojanischer-freund-und-helfer-1706-128529.html)

I finally installed [LineageOS](https://lineageos.org) on my Nexus 5X.

Took me 3 hours to figure out that I have to flash boot.img from the factory image.

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.mkg20001.zeronet
It's live now! ZeroNet4Android! (currently published by someone who gave me access to his account)

Still working on https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-js
A lot of bugs need to be fixed and a lot of things need to be added but I hope that in a few months everything should work.

## Just added the ultimate feature to ZeroNetJS: libp2p-websocket-star

**tl;dr The NAT problem was just solved**

websocket-star is a webrtc-free version of libp2p-webrtc-star and it basically acts as a socket.io rendezvous point (meaning peers do not need UPNP port forwarding). 
e.g: Peer connects to the server. Wants to connect to other peer. creates id. send request to server with destination address and id. Server creates connection between those 2


NOTE: ZeroNetJS still is far from finished but if you want to you can [download](https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-js) and try it

ZeroNetJS can now exchange files from browser/server to browser/server (a bit buggy and it just downloads all files at once without a real queue)

To use that web-bundle just click the button after it says the node is offline wait 5 sec then click "Add ZeroHello"

You can "view" the downloaded files afterwards by running `node.zitem.zites["1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D"]
.tree.storage.storage.mocks.file` in the browser console

https://zeronetjs.github.io/znjs-web-bundle/

Update: Just released [v0.0.1-alpha18](https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-js/releases/tag/v0.0.1-alpha18). Test it and report issues to https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-js/issues
I'm still alive. Usually I don't do much on ZeroMe as there is little activity. But that nows seems to have changed... So I decided to post this litte piece of text :D

Still working on https://github.com/ZeroNetJS/zeronet-js

News:
 - FINALLY tls was added
 - Working on a new less CPU/memory intense way to quickly connect to a bunch of peers
 - Soon a new release will be out

In the future I will be working on changing the zites related code to work with IPLD, so I don't have to rewrite so much code and spend time reinventing the wheel

comment.body: @Poweredbyte: :D
@Cer: I wait until I can use ZeroNet as an replacement for them (gmail and stuff)
If politicans can't agree with each other, they start a war (they force the other party to agree)

I will look into that later, currently I am trying to fix this error:
```
02-19 12:22:06.062 24977 25020 F art     : art/runtime/java_vm_ext.cc:470] JNI DETECTED ERROR IN APPLICATION: static jfieldID 0xea75c014 not valid for class java.lang.Class<org.renpy.android.PythonActivity>
02-19 12:22:06.062 24977 25020 F art     : art/runtime/java_vm_ext.cc:470]     in call to GetStaticObjectField
02-19 12:22:06.062 24977 25020 F art     : art/runtime/java_vm_ext.cc:470]     from int org.libsdl.app.SDLActivity.nativeInit(java.lang.Object)
```
Any idea how to fix that?
@P2P: Ok, I will try it with the old SDK/NDK
@P2P: Could the android_new toolchain be the problem?
@P2P: Your apk worked, mine didn't. Could you tell me more about your build enviroment?
@P2P: Same error with SDK v20
@P2P: how exactly do I do that?
@P2P: OMG! It works!
@P2P: Is there a way to translate strings, like in normal android apps?
@P2P: For example: Label: strings.zerohello - en.xml: strings.zerohello="ZeroHello - ZeroNet Homepage" - de.xml: strings.zerohello="ZeroHello - ZeroNet Startseite"
@P2P: I think the app should be rewritten so it imports the commands for different platforms. Is that a good idea?
@P2P: And we could just append a letter to the version to fix that
@P2P: I have rewritten the app. Does the code now look/work better or have I made things worse?
@P2P: Was it just installing libbz2-dev or did you have to install the bz2 python module too?
@P2P: Ok
@P2P: But I think I will do i18n the same way zeronet does it. Simple JSON
@P2P: I think it should use something different instead of the version. Maybe installation date or a timestamp?
@P2P: Any idea how to solve the font problem with the Roboto Font (Chinese characters not appearing) ?
@P2P: Is there any way to mix the characters from the DroidSansFallback and Roboto font (so DroidSansFallback is used if the character is missing) ?
@P2P: https://github.com/kivy/kivy/issues/1701

@P2P: I discovered it by accident. And yes, kivy's get_color_from_hex works. But IMO the app needs a light and a dark theme, so this function will make it easier (because it converts the color to a light one)

@P2P: And DroidSansFallback does not support bold text
Edit: It also does not support the German characters ä ö ü
@P2P: But that does not fix the issue with text not being bold
@P2P: What changes/files exactly are overwritten?
@P2P: Currently I am writing a ConfigParser (or actually looking how zeronet parses the config). After that I will add `language` and `keep_ssl_cert`

@P2P: `Skipping a deployment with the releases provider because this is not a tagged commit.` This happens because travis-ci only uploads the apk to tags (See https://github.com/mkg20001/ZeroNet-kivy/releases )

@P2P: No I don't know, but what actually is the reason a custom ssl cert has to be created?
Edit: The code in `zeronet_config.py` is actually from zeronet `src/Config.py`
@P2P: https://github.com/mkg20001/ZeroNet-kivy/releases/tag/0.5.2.1-alpha1 - but it will take 30 min for the APK to be built
@P2P: Thx
@Mynameislegion: Does setting the background image work for you? I've just created a test account and it doesn't work for me but it works on my main account
@Mynameislegion: The fix was to post an image after uploading the background. That caused bg.jpg to be an optional file somehow
@Begdi: Sorry I don't speak chinese
@Begdi: Thx

@Plasmmer: These are compiled coffescript files. Unless I find a decompiler I will have to rewrite them from scratch. Also I noticed ZeroMe+ uses a different image format that we should add support for (markdown inline images)
@Mynameislegion: There was a bug. Now the settings for the background should be visible

Maybe. I hope that will happen.

@P2P: Yes it needs servers but it's more like tor relays (everyone can run such a server, the client can listen on multiple. it could be made dynamic at some point). Also it won't be the only method of communication. There is still TCP+UPNP and later Tor and maybe I2P.

@P2P: Small update: Libp2p is working on circuit relaying which would allow browsers to use any client with websocket support as a websocket-star server (which means that it would be a lot more like tor / a lot more distributed)
